lines.content: * Chatbot to help users manage their tasks.
* Supports Todos, Deadline and Event tasks.
protected static TaskList lst = new TaskList();
protected static Storage storage = new Storage();
* Main Function that controls the ChatBot
* Searches for task based on Search Keyword.
* Finds specified String in current list of tasks
* Abstraction of Task Storage by Duke.
* Loads the serializable list of Tasks that have been previously stored.
* Returns empty List if no previous entries found.
// Create the file if it doesn't exist
* Adds a Task to the TaskList.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this duke.task:");
* Displays the tasks in the task list.
* Tasks are numbered and each begin on a new line
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Marks a Task on the TaskList as complete.
* @param i index of the task to be marked as complete.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this duke.task as done:");
* Marks a Task on the TaskList as incomplete.
* @param i index of the task to be marked as incomplete.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this duke.task as not done yet:");
* Deletes a Task on the TaskList.
* @param i index of the task to be deleted.
* Counts the number of Tasks on the TaskList.
System.out.println("Now you have " + this.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Receives String input from user, and parses to the accurate task.
LIST, BYE, MARK, UNMARK, TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, DELETE, FIND, UNKNOWN
* Parses user string to get Task Details.
* @param desc description of Deadline in required format
* @param desc input required in the form of {@code name /from YYYY-MM-DD /to YYYY-MM-DD}
return "[E]" + super.toString() + " (from: " + this.from.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy")) + " to: " + this.to.format(DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy")) + ")";
* Inherits from Serializable to store tasks into binary files.
* To be used only by Child Classes of Task.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done duke.task with X
System.out.println("Hello! I'm Ally\n" + "What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
public void startFind() { System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");}

// Save the list to the file
assertTrue(tempFile.exists(), "File should be created after saving tasks.");
// Load the list from the file
// Check if the loaded list contains the expected task
assertEquals(1, loadedList.size(), "Loaded list should contain one task.");
assertEquals("[T][ ] Test task", loadedList.get(0).toString(), "The description of the loaded task should match.");
// Delete the temporary file if it exists

private final ByteArrayOutputStream outputStreamCaptor = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
* This is to not interfere with functions after testing
* Tests addition of task to list.
String expectedOutput = "Got it. I've added this duke.task:\n" + newTask.toString() + "\n" +
"Now you have 1 tasks in the list.\n";
